parsers package

parsers.professor_parser module

教授資訊解析模組

class parsers.professor_parser.ProfessorParser[source]

Bases: object

Professor Information Parser

static parse_html(html: str) → list[dict][source]

Parses the provided HTML content to extract information about professors.

Parameters:

html (str) – The HTML content of the page to be parsed.

Returns:

A list of dictionaries, each containing professor information, with the following structure:

  • ’姓名’: The professor’s name (str or None if not found).

  • ’職稱’: The professor’s position or academic title (str or None if not found).

  • ’學歷’: The professor’s education background (str or None if not found).

  • ’經歷’: A list of the professor’s experiences (list of str, or an empty list if not found).

  • ’研究領域’: A list of the professor’s research areas (list of str, or an empty list if not found).

  • ’email’: The professor’s email (str or None if not found).

  • ’辦公室’: The professor’s office location (str or None if not found).

  • ’Office hour’: The professor’s office hours (str or None if not found, or a link to the schedule).

Return type:

list

static extract_professor_info(li_elements, html_content)[source]

Extracts detailed information about a professor from the given HTML elements.

Parameters:

  • li_elements (list) – A list of <li> elements that contain professor information.

  • html_content (str) – The raw HTML content, used to extract the professor’s email.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the extracted information about the professor. The dictionary

includes the following keys: - ‘姓名’: The professor’s name (str or None if not found). - ‘職稱’: The professor’s position or academic title (str or None if not found). - ‘學歷’: The professor’s education background (str or None if not found). - ‘經歷’: A list of the professor’s experiences (list of str, or an empty list if not found). - ‘研究領域’: A list of the professor’s research areas (list of str, or an empty list if not found). - ‘email’: The professor’s email (str or None if not found). - ‘辦公室’: The professor’s office location (str or None if not found). - ‘Office hour’: The professor’s office hours (str or None if not found, or a link to the schedule).

Return type:

dict

static extract_email(html_string)[source]

Extracts and decodes the email address from the HTML content.

Parameters:

html_string (str) – The HTML string containing the encoded email.

Returns:

The decoded email address (or None if not found or decoding fails).

Return type:

str
